title: How to write without cursive handwriting - Quora

response.answer_text: How do I stop writing in cursive? A question I would have never have seen the need to ask, but if I had to answer, and as this is the new, improved Quora, I would suggest the following: Remove the implant - if you can. There may be healthcare assistance …. Start using your feet to hold the writing implement. Your mind will follow. Embark on an intensive, but therapeutic, co-dependency treatment regime. After a few weeks, you may see the possibility of attaining your goal. Don’t give up - you can do it!

If you have to write a lot and quickly, there’s shorthand. For normal purposes, just imitate letters like the ones typed here. Or type. Alternate technological resources allow you simply to speak and an iPhone, iPad, computer or other gadget writes for you. If recording your voice counts as writing, there are many gadgets for that too.

First of all why do you want to stop writing in cursive ? According to graphologist people with cursive handwriting have a logical mindset. But if you still wish , then my friend you have to just start practicing not writing in cursive. Make a notebook for handwriting and write a single page (both sides) everyday in the handwriting you wish to write.
Try to write slower and don’t connect your letters at all (if you do, connect them only slightly.) Also, try to write straight slanted because most cursive is right-slanted.
I print in all caps when I need to write by hand. That said, I type as much as I can.
